data.question: What method was used for the synthesis of UiO-66?
What was the temperature used for the pre-treatment of the catalysts before catalytic testing?
What technique was employed to measure the NO2 adsorption ability of the catalysts?
How was the Cu/UiO-66 catalyst prepared for the NTP-assisted deNOx reaction?
data.answer: It was reduced in a tube furnace with 5% H2 flow at 250 °C for 2 h.

data.question: What was the specific energy input (SEI) calculated for the NTP-assisted catalytic reaction?
What was the main Cu species identified in the catalyst after the plasma reaction according to XPS and Auger spectra?
What change in the EPR spectrum of Cu/UiO-66 was observed after NO2 loading?
data.answer: A shift in the Cu(II) signals indicating interaction with NO2

data.question: What was the purpose of using HYSCORE spectroscopy in the study?
data.answer: To investigate the local environment of the Cu(II) site and its interaction with surrounding 1H nuclei

data.question: True or False: The BET surface area of Cu/UiO-66 increased after being used in the plasma reaction.
True or False: The operando DRIFTS experiments were conducted to monitor the decomposition of NO2 over the catalyst under plasma conditions.
True or False: The synthesis of UiO-66-NH2 differed from UiO-66 only in the use of 2-aminoterephthalic acid instead of terephthalic acid.
What was the main finding from the in situ and operando DRIFTS spectra regarding the interaction of NO2 with the catalyst?
data.answer: The formation of various monodentate, bidentate, and bridging nitro/nitrate species on the catalyst surface

data.question: What was the role of non-thermal plasma (NTP) in the catalytic testing setup?
data.answer: To activate the decomposition of NO2 over the catalyst at room temperature

data.question: How was the stability of the Cu/UiO-66 catalyst assessed after the catalytic reaction?
data.answer: By comparing the PXRD patterns, EPR spectra, XPS spectra, and BET surface areas of fresh and used catalysts

data.question: What was the significance of the 1H HYSCORE signal observed in the study?
data.answer: It indicated the presence of protons from H2O coordinated in the equatorial plane of a Cu(II) ion, consistent with Cu–O–H connectivity
